Title: The Whole Wide World
Writer: Novalyne Price Ellis (memoir One Who Walked Alone), Michael Scott Myers (screenplay)
Actors: Vincent D'Onofrio, Renée Zellweger, Ann Wedgeworth, Harve Presnell
Plot: In Texas in the 1930s, young schoolteacher Novalyne Price meets a handsome, eccentric, interesting young man named Robert Howard. He's a successful writer - of the pulp stories of 'Conan the Barbarian'; she's an aspiring one. A friendship develops into a sort of courtship. Based on a memoir by Novalyne Price.
